image.altText: A man with brown hair and beard carries a white piece of paper as he walks outside a building.

props.synopsis: A 49-year-old Canberra man is charged with murder after a man he fought at the caravan park where they both lived died of his injuries.

title.children: Canberra man charged with murder after assault victim dies of injuries

image.altText: The exterior of a white marble building with a sign reading "Law Court of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: The 43-year-old man was found guilty of attacking his partner, despite her having withdrawn her complaint against him.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for attacking 'frightened' partner who retracted statement

image.altText: Julie Bishop looks serious at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Australian National University chancellor Julie Bishop again confirms she will not resign despite mounting pressure against her, saying she intends to remain in the role and see the institution through its restructure.

title.children: ANU chancellor Julie Bishop digs in and vows to remain in job

image.altText: A smartly dressed woman with short hair leaves a court building next to a man in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Former Canberra Institute of Technology CEO Leanne Cover loses her bid to challenge a finding that she engaged in "serious corrupt conduct" over the arrangement of contracts to a consultant.

title.children: Former CIT CEO loses bid to challenge finding she engaged in 'serious corrupt conduct'

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: A teenage girl is facing five charges, including an allegation she encouraged her ex-partner to take his own life in an angry stream of messages after she ended their relationship.

title.children: Jury urged to consider age of teen accused of assault, harassment of ex

image.altText: A woman walking outside court.

props.synopsis: A Canberra court hears a former business owner who pleaded guilty to sexual offences against three former employees has shown no remorse for her offending, instead portraying her actions as consensual to minimise her responsibility.

title.children: Former Canberra business owner jailed for grooming teen employees

image.altText: A tail of a Qantas plane is seen on the runway at Sydney Airport, Sydney,

props.synopsis: There are concerns the decision could impact regional flights, as staff would have to travel from Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane to get to work.

title.children: Qantas may close staff bases in Mildura, Canberra and Hobart

image.altText: Neville Bonner in bronze.

props.synopsis: Neville Bonner is honoured as Australia's first Indigenous parliamentarian with a bronze sculpture commemorating his life and legacy outside Old Parliament House.

title.children: First Indigenous parliamentarian's iconic boomerang throw immortalised

image.altText: Abigail Pawlett hits the deck

props.synopsis: Australia's heptathletes get their World Athletics Championship campaigns up and running, as Aussie trios aim for a final spot in the women's 800m and the men's 5,000m. Follow live.

title.children: Heavy fall mars opening event of heptathlon as Aussies open campaign

image.altText: Tom Stewart is tended to by a Geelong trainer

props.synopsis: Geelong and Hawthorn meet in a preliminary final for the first time since 2013 as both eye a spot in the AFL grand final. Follow live.

title.children: Geelong star concussed in huge tackle as miracle goal ignites Hawthorn

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Watson drills a miraculous goal from the pocket
Stewart subbed out with a concussion

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and James Marape signing

props.synopsis: China has urged Papua New Guinea not to sign any deal that might exclude or restrict third parties from cooperating with the Pacific nation, as Australia scrambles to clinch a landmark defence treaty.

title.children: China responds to Australia's defence treaty with PNG

image.altText: bruce lehrmann walking outside court

props.synopsis: Mr Lehrmann is facing two charges of rape, alleged to have occurred in Toowoomba in 2021. He's indicated he intends to plead not guilty.

title.children: Court hears Bruce Lehrmann's defence missing rape complainant's phone data

image.altText: Hannah Thomas with eye patch in black hoodie

props.synopsis: Hannah Thomas, who sustained an eye injury during an arrest at a pro-Palestinian rally, is awarded legal costs to the tune of nearly $22,000 after all of her charges were dropped.

title.children: Ex-Greens candidate injured in protest awarded $22k over dropped case

image.altText: A man holds a sign saying "We love Jimmy Kimmel".

props.synopsis: Jimmy Kimmel's fellow late-night stars accuse the Trump administration of overriding free speech with the indefinite axing of the ABC America host, as parent company, Walt Disney, faces growing protests.

title.children: Jon Stewart hosts 'patriotically obedient' show to decry Jimmy Kimmel axing

image.altText: Man wearing a suit and glasses, l;ooking dow, walks forward while surrounded by media

props.synopsis: Jailed bus driver Brett Button and the bus company that employed him have been added as defendants in a class action stemming from a crash that killed 10 people.

title.children: Deadly wedding crash class action includes jailed driver, bus company

image.altText: A woman wipes away tears as she tells her story.

props.synopsis: The failed First Guardian and Shield schemes have cost about 12,000 Australians more than $1 billion in retirement savings and exposed deep flaws in how Australia's $4.3 trillion superannuation sector is regulated.

title.children: Collapses expose deep flaws in Australia's $4.3 trillion super system

image.altText: A white woman, short blonde hair, wearing glasses, white blazer and blue top. Standing in front of blurred green background

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's attorney-general is facing backlash after failing to publicly declare a potential conflict of interest regarding a fatal hit-and-run driver before court.

title.children: Conflict of interest claims over attorney-general's link to hit-run driver

image.altText: A woman sits with her head down

props.synopsis: Hakyung Lee has been charged with murdering her children and has pleaded not guilty by reason of insanity after leaving their bodies in an Auckland storage facility.

title.children: NZ mum accused of killing children had 'a disease of the mind', court hears

image.altText: Princess Kate and Melania Trump walking with young scouts

props.synopsis: As US President Donald Trump left Windsor to meet UK Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer, first lady Melania Trump spent the day with the Princess of Wales and Queen Camilla.

title.children: Chequers, scout groups and a dolls' house — day two of Trump's state visit in pictures

image.altText: A number of wind turbines in a desert landscape at dusk with a full moon rising

props.synopsis: We don't have to wait for moonshot technologies to reach our climate targets. Most of the solutions to the climate crisis are already around us.

title.children: 'How to keep the lights on' conversation totally ignores where we are already at

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt sitting on a chair with a dining table and kitchen behind him

props.synopsis: The doctor who called triple murderer Erin Patterson a "crazy bitch" and a "sociopath" has been sanctioned by AHPRA, but says he does not regret making the comments about the mushroom murderer.

title.children: Doctor stands by Erin Patterson 'sociopath' comments despite AHPRA sanction

image.altText: A blonde woman wearing a beige coat walks holding the hand of a man wearing a black suit

props.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron and his wife, Brigitte Macron, have said they intend to provide evidence in court to disprove a right-wing influencer's claims the French first lady is transgender.

title.children: 'Scientific' evidence will seek to prove the French president's wife is a woman. Here's what to know

image.altText: A yellow sign with red writing advertising the language school.

props.synopsis: The search at one of the state's biggest Chinese language schools relates to an investigation into alleged misuse of public funding.

title.children: One of Victoria's largest Chinese schools raided by corruption watchdog

image.altText: Owen Cooper

props.synopsis: A lot happened this week. Have you been paying attention?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A royal visit, a glitzy award show and a new city plays host to Laneway

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: A man who was found guilty of the "execution-style murder" of his "unarmed" tenant on the northern outskirts of Adelaide has been jailed for at least 28 years.

title.children: Landlord who murdered tenant sentenced to at least 28 years in prison

image.altText: A man wearing a navy flannelette shirt over a tee stands beside a canal filled with trash

props.synopsis: Unexpected and deadly flooding rocked Bali last week at a scale many had never experienced before. In the wake of this disaster, the search for answers has begun.

title.children: Is a surge in overtourism literally flooding Bali?

image.altText: A courtyard with climbers and lush green plants, with a built-in white seat. The view is from the living room, with a couch.

props.synopsis: Living in a smaller space doesn't mean you can't have a lush garden. Here's how to rejuvenate your garden with some easy tips.

title.children: You don't need much space or sun to have a flourishing garden

image.altText: Cowboys women practice on their training paddock outdoors.

props.synopsis: As the Cowboys eye the path to premiership glory ahead of their sudden-death semifinal against the Sharks, they are also creating pathways off field for the next generation of NRLW stars.

title.children: Cowboys create a path for next NRLW stars with finals footy

image.altText: A fisherman casts his rod as storm clouds pass over Botany Bay in Sydney

props.synopsis: Australia's key drivers of weather variability are stacking up to produce another wet, severe-weather season, with an increased risk of flooding, thunderstorms and cyclones.

title.children: Surprise La Niña hints at another wet and stormy Australian summer

image.altText: McLaren's Oscar Piastri during a press conference, smiling, hands on his heads

props.synopsis: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri says McLaren has "had a lot of discussions" since the controversial ending to the Italian Grand Prix two weekends ago.

title.children: Piastri ready to push forward after controversy over McLaren team orders

image.altText: A woman and a man, faces unseen, sit side by side while holding a photograph.

props.synopsis: Steven Callanan had the world at his feet and loved footy like it was a religion. The talented player could bring together communities while he played, but after a night of partying he took his own life.

title.children: Shattered parents call for change after 21-year-old footy star's death

image.altText: Vladimir Putin stands near a pile of drones at a drone factory among other men in suits.

props.synopsis: Ukraine is struggling to defend against growing drone attacks, and with Russia's mass production factories in full-swing there are fears thousands will soon be launched in a single night.

title.children: Hundreds of drones swarm Ukraine nightly. Soon there could be thousands

image.altText: Small buildings surrounded by swirling brown and muddied sea water next to green vegetation

props.synopsis: A quake that struck at a depth of 10 kilometres off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula sparks warnings of potential waves three metres above a standard tide level in parts of the Pacific.

title.children: Magnitude-7.8 Russian quake rocks homes as residents flee into streets

image.altText: A rabbit burrow beside a bluestone-looking grave, bunch of flowers in front, blue sky and green trees.

props.synopsis: The Junee Shire Council says it is battling a rabbit problem, which forced a recent closure of the town's main cemetery for a week, including on Father's Day, for a baiting program.

title.children: Rabbits digging near graves, cause 'devastating' damage in cemetery
